intro: Hancea dryobalanoides, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Hancea dryobalanoides prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
